result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Averiona C Hines

3:11 PM Defendant Averiona C Hines in court.  Attorney Paul S. Crawford in court for Averiona C Hines. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder.  Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Case was set for a plea/sentencing hearing. 

Defense requests to set for another further proceeding to do further research on case for possible filing of motions. 
State does not object. 
Court sets.
Hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 12, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Authorization to appear received and filed.  Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.

Atty Crawford requests a plea/sentencing hearing be set.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Court Grants - Appointment of Counsel.
